Author: KomodoWorld#8282
Content: Ok I got some info, this is a conference to onboard new people, most will have never used crypto before. The speaking slots are not fitting because it's not about a specific brand or project but more crypto in general, experiences with crypto, how people got in, etc... like TED talks.    But there are also a few demo slots where you can let attendees install and use a blockchain app. Perhaps this will be a chance to demo BarterDEX or Pangea Poker to a totally new audience.

Author: KomodoWorld#8282
Content: `deploying a working product to our audience: we're expecting 2000+ people, many of whom have never used crypto or blockchain products before. Attendees will be strongly incentivized to install our partners' products on their devices before the event and partners will have stage time with the audience during the event in order to engage with the product. This is a paid option and results in specific installs, DAUs and real user feedback at scale. We've got 8-10 slots here and 5 area already called for so let me know if this is something interesting to you`

Author: Roxin#4844
Content: hello

Author: Roxin#4844
Content: if i have agama wallet and have coins there...if i install windows again, what should i have to backup to have the coins again after windows is new ? thanks

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: @Roxin did you use lite or native mode?

Author: Roxin#4844
Content: for the moment i just want to install it, i dont use it yet..what is better ?  @PTYX

Author: Roxin#4844
Content: lite or native ?

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: Lite is easier to manage.

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: You get a 12 or 24 word seed which backs up your wallet

Author: Roxin#4844
Content: so lite i dont have to backup just the 24 word ?

Author: Roxin#4844
Content: files or smth else i dont have to backup ? just the word ? and i have all the coins backed up in that word ?

Author: Roxin#4844
Content: @PTYX

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: yes, the seed (24 words) is used to restore your wallet or to export your privatekeys if you ever need to use them in a native wallet.

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: native wallets require you to save a file called a wallet.dat. It's a file that holds all your private-keys. If you lose the wallet.dat or don't back it up constantly you risk losing access to change addresses.
